channel.title: What to do with extra computer?
channel.description:
I currently use it for botting, but I'd rather do something else with it. I was thinking of maybe setting up a simple web-server on it considering my ISP doesn't block port 80. I would set it up with Fedora (or CentOS) and lighttpd. But, I need some ideas, thoughts?
Edit: Specs Intel Pentium 4 Processor @ 1.6GHz 1G DDR Ram
So it couldn't handle something too ridiculous.

item.title: What to do with extra computer?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

general home server? access your files via ssh while you’re out? that’s about it…

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with extra computer?

item.title: What to do with extra computer?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

abraham2119:

put it up for sell as a vps?

People don’t buy VPS’s on regular home connections, usually.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do with extra computer?
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:2, topic:325180”]What do you need ideas for? Do understand the purpose of a web server? If not, you don’t need one.

Personally, I use mine to host movies encoded as mp4 so I can stream them onto my iPod Touch without having to fuck around in iTunes for years on end.[/quote]
It would be for local testing most likely, then again I could just run WAMP as normal like I currently do. But your movie idea is a good one too.

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with extra computer?

item.title: What to do with extra computer?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

What do you need ideas for? Do understand the purpose of a web server? If not, you don’t need one.

Personally, I use mine to host movies encoded as mp4 so I can stream them onto my iPod Touch without having to fuck around in iTunes for years on end.
